intro: Haworthia laeta, commonly known as the Zulu Lily or the Little Star, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features compact, rosette-shaped leaves that are typically pale green with distinct white or yellowish markings. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or orange during the spring or summer. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it ideal for arid environments. Haworthia laeta is prized for its ornamental value and ease of care in indoor gardening.
